snippet: A leading credit-rating service lowered its ratings on California's bonds on Friday, saying the tardy state budget approved by Gov. Pete Wilson and the Legislature included a $1 billion "de facto deficit."   Fitch's Investors Service lowered the r...
lead_paragraph: A leading credit-rating service lowered its ratings on California's bonds on Friday, saying the tardy state budget approved by Gov. Pete Wilson and the Legislature included a $1 billion "de facto deficit." Fitch's Investors Service lowered the rating from AA+ to AA after a meeting at the state Treasurer's office in Sacramento.
